head.title: COVID-19 District Info - Bristol Tennessee City Schools

meta.content: Bristol Tennessee City Schools is actively monitoring the status of the COVID-19 virus in order to remain aware of current information and guidance.

p.span: All information on our website is available in additional languages. If viewing on a computer, go to the Language menu at the top left of the page. If viewing on a mobile device, click on Admin at the top of the page to access the Language menu.

Toda la informacin que est en nuestro sitio web est disponible en otros idiomas. Si usted est viendo este documento en una computadora, vaya al men de idiomas que est en la esquina superior izquierda de esta pgina. Si usted est usando un dispositivo mvil, Pulse en el botn Admin en la parte superior de la pgina para acceder al men de idiomas.

Like many of you, we are continually monitoring the situation regarding COVID-19 (Coronavirus) and how it is affecting individuals, schools, and communities across the world. In an ongoing, collaborative effort, all three school districts in Sullivan County are working together and with local health agencies throughout this situation. This information has guided planning and operational decision-making for all of us, following the guidance of the Sullivan County Health Department, the Tennessee Department of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control. Relying on these experts is allowing us to make informed, coordinated, data-driven decisions based on the most current medical information.

As you know, the situation is fluid and changes frequently. We are seeking to keep you informed as quickly as possible as soon as decisions are made. This information will come via our website, Facebook, Twitter, SchoolMessenger phone calls, and parent and staff emails.

span.span: For the most up-to-date medical information about COVID-19, please refer to the CDC website
or call the Sullivan County Health Department at (423) 279-2777.

p.span: Please refer to our additional links for further school district communications and resources regarding COVID-19. These can be accessed to the left if viewing on your computer or by clicking on the "+" symbol at the top of your browser if viewing on a mobile device.

div.p: Our website is in compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. If you have questions or concerns regarding the accessibility of the website or if you are unable to access information on the website, you may email or call the Technology Department at (423) 652-9363.
